meanings.definition: The process of separating particles based on their size and density using a liquid medium.
meanings.sent1: During the elutriation, the heavier particles settled at the bottom.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use elutriation to sort different-sized particles in a mixture.
meanings.sent3: The elutriation of the sand grains was like a tiny dance party in the water.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an elutriation of thoughts, each one settling in its own space.
meanings.sent5: The elutriation of the colored beads created a beautiful gradient in the liquid.

meanings.definition: To separate or purify a substance by elutriation.
meanings.sent1: She carefully elutriated the mixture to obtain the purest form of the compound.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician elutriated the sample to remove any impurities.
meanings.sent3: He elutriated the ingredients in the bowl as if performing a magical spell.
meanings.sent4: The artist elutriated the colors on the canvas, creating a mesmerizing blend.
meanings.sent5: The chef elutriated the spices to ensure a perfect balance of flavors in the dish.

meanings.definition: The act of washing or rinsing a material to remove impurities.
meanings.sent1: After the elutriation, the fabric was clean and free of any dirt.
meanings.sent2: Elutriation is an important step in the purification process of ores.
meanings.sent3: The elutriation of the vegetables in the sink was like a mini waterfall.
meanings.sent4: His words went through an elutriation process before he spoke them out loud.
meanings.sent5: The elutriation of the seeds ensured a healthy crop yield for the farmer.
